title: Vintage Train Sets
description: All aboard! Test your knowledge of the model trains and train sets that chugged through living rooms for decades.

questions.question: Which company, founded in 1900, became the most iconic American model train brand?
What scale did American Flyer trains famously use, which featured two-rail realistic track?
Lionel trains traditionally ran on track with how many rails?
What holiday tradition made model train sets one of the most popular gifts of the year?
The famous Lionel catalog, eagerly awaited by children each year, was first published in what decade?
What was the name of the affordable Marx train sets that made model railroading accessible to many families in the 1950s?
HO scale model trains, which became popular in the 1950s-60s, are what ratio to real trains?
What did many children use to create realistic landscapes around their train sets?
Which Lionel train accessory featured a small figure that popped out of a building to hand a mailbag to a passing train?
What type of transformer was commonly used to control the speed of electric model trains?
The iconic Lionel 'smoke unit' made model train locomotives appear to emit real smoke. What did it burn to create the effect?
Which department store was famous for its elaborate Christmas model train displays that drew thousands of visitors?
What was the typical material used for model train track in the postwar era?
Gilbert, the company that made American Flyer trains, was also famous for producing what other popular toy?
What common household item did many hobbyists traditionally place under Christmas trees alongside their model train layouts?
